description: In addition to the traditional practices of literary study, cross-disciplinary courses include materials from at least one other academic discipline, requiring students to compare and combine disciplinary perspectives in literary analysis. Examples of courses taught under this heading might include Literature and Politics; Religion and the Novel; Philosophical Approaches to Literature. May be repeated if topic is different. Prerequisite: FYW.
name: Top: Shakespeare/Material Culture
notes: There will be a materials fee for this course, which will not exceed $75.
title: Topics in Cross-Disciplinary Literary Study
